title.content-text: 3.5 1- Maintaining V LAN's on the Enterprise Network

brief.content-text:
This animation depicts the difference between managing switches using VTP and not using V T P management. The network has five switches connected in a series.

Without VTP
Without VTP configured, the network administrator must manually add, delete, and rename V LANs.

With VTP
With VTP configured, the network administrator must manually add, delete, and rename V LAN's on the first switch only. Then the first switch sends a message to the other switches further down the link to automatically add, delete, or rename the V LAN's. This process occurs with each switch connected.
